headline: Expect abundant wildlife, but specific sightings are never guaranteed
summary: On a well-planned safari, you will see significant wildlife. The Big Five (lion, leopard, elephant, rhino, buffalo) are likely but not guaranteed on every trip. Leopard and rhino are the hardest; lion, elephant, and buffalo are almost certain in good areas. Managing expectations about specific species while appreciating overall wildlife abundance leads to satisfaction.

assumptions.text: In prime areas, 4 of 5 Big Five species are typically seen; all 5 requires luck.
Leopard is the most elusive Big Five member; some areas have better odds.
Total wildlife abundance in good areas exceeds most first-timers' expectations.

gains: Overall wildlife abundance typically exceeds expectations
Lion, elephant, and buffalo sightings are highly likely
Bird diversity and smaller animals reward attention
losses: Leopard and rhino require luck and patience
Kill sightings depend entirely on timing

change_conditions: If leopard is a priority, choose known leopard territories like Sabi Sands or South Luangwa.
If rhino is essential, include areas with healthy rhino populations explicitly.
If specific behaviors (kills, river crossings) matter, extend trip length for more chances.
